items.sentence: The public library will be giving away old books this Monday.
A white-haired man was playing an accordion outside the shop.
Tom thinks that he can trust Mary not to do something stupid.
Tom should understand that we're doing this for his own good.
Tom says that he thinks that it won't be possible to do that.
I think that we should tell Tom that he needs to work harder.
I think that it's unlikely that Tom will ask Mary to do that.

I don't know whether we can do that without Tom's permission.
